body_html:
I guess I should've spent some more time on the input pipeline. I was assuming those estimators support multiple series (for example multivariate https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/timeseries/examples/multivariate.py) so I could use part of the series (one of the columns in the data) as weights. Please correct me if I misunderstood something here.
…
On Mon, Oct 2, 2017 at 12:30 PM Allen Lavoie ***@***.***> wrote: Right now the Estimators operate on a single series. What is getting weighted here? body:
I guess I should've spent some more time on the input pipeline. I was
assuming those estimators support multiple series (for example multivariate
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/timeseries/examples/multivariate.py)
so I could use part of the series (one of the columns in the data)  as
weights. Please correct me if I misunderstood something here.

On Mon, Oct 2, 2017 at 12:30 PM Allen Lavoie <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Right now the Estimators operate on a single series. What is getting
> weighted here? Parts of the series?
